means: （对别人不知道的秘密）知悉的

sentence.Network_en: By the time he's twenty he'll know everyone worth knowing in Washington.
sentence.Network_cn: 到20岁时，他就会认识华盛顿所有值得认识的人。

sentence.Network_en: He fumbled his lines, not knowing what he was going to say.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因为不知道接下来要说什么而把台词给念砸了。

sentence.Network_en: I started puttering around outside, not knowing what I was doing.
sentence.Network_cn: 我开始在外面闲荡，不知道自己在做什么。

entry.tran: 会意的；心照不宣的；知情的
entry.def: A knowing gesture or remark is one that shows that you understand something, for example the way that someone is feeling or what they really mean, even though it has not been mentioned directly.

example.ex: Ron gave her a knowing smile...
Dan exchanged a knowing look with Harry.
example.tran: 丹和哈丽心照不宣地交换了一下眼神。

means.word_mean: 1. evidencing the possession of inside information

sentences.sentence: "the most...technically aware of the novelists under thirty"- W.S.Graham
"surprisingly knowledgeable about what was going on"

means.word_mean: 4. highly educated; having extensive information or understanding;

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"状态物品,行业等"; 2. 表介词,"在……情况下……"; 3. 表形容词,"正……的或令人……的"; 4. "……的"

change变化+ing正……的或令人……的→正在变化的
correspond通信;符合+ing……的→adj.相应的,通讯的
discriminate辨别,歧视+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有辨别能力的
encourage鼓励+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.鼓舞人心的
endure持久,持续+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.持久的,不朽的
engross吸引+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.引人入胜的

Sentence.sentence: An extraordinarily important study skill is knowing how to mark a book.

Learning to express ideas well in both writing and speech, knowing how to find information, and knowing how to do research are all solid background skills for a wide variety of roles, and such training is more important than any particular major in a liberal arts college.

Learning to express ideas well in both writing and speech, knowing how to find information, and knowing how to do research are all solid background skills for a wide variety of roles, and such training is more important than any particular major in a liberal arts college.
Globally, knowing more than one language is viewed as an asset and even a necessity in many areas.
Some schools out for profit cynically increase tuitions and count on student loans and federal aid to foot the bill – knowing full well that the students won't make it.

means.word_mean: (对别人不知道的秘密)知悉的,心照不宣的
难以预料；无从知道；没法说

sentences.en: There is no telling what he may do when he gets angry.
sentences.cn: 难以预料他愤怒时会做出什么事。

sentences.en: There’s no saying what will happen.
